alert.note: Alert for Goshen; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:08PM MDT until June 22 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 1045 PM MDT. * At 808 PM MDT, emergency management reported water still running over Highway 85 south of Hawk Springs. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Grange, Yoder, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Recreation Area and Hawk Springs Campground. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
